alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 9:38PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Decatur and southeastern Red Willow Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Danbury, or 9 miles southeast of McCook, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oberlin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
